page.title: 06HAMLET, MWYNDY CROSS
page.content: {LANDSCAPE:}On a low hill overlooking the river Clun Valley, 1 mile southeast of Talbot Green.{ {POSITION: It is on the}crossroads of the Llantrisant to Cardiff and Miskin to Cross Inn routes. {HISTORY: }Provided minerals and stone, served by a spur of railway line, now abandoned. Today, replaced by a coal processing plant with much pollution, explosives storage and one or two minor industries. Nearby are two petrol filling stations, and a Heavy Goods Vehicle Testing Station. {PROBLEMS:}The hamlet is dispersing because the new Cardiff Rd. built in the cutting has separated the village in two and it is now a hazardous crossing point from Miskin. New development is difficult owing to present planning and zoning restrictions.
